body:
Comment 3 by **russel.winder**: 
I don't think simply disabling the network tests is a useful direction.  I will check,
but I am fairly certain that "firewall" is not an issue.  The firewall between internal
network and the wider Internet cannot be an issue as the build works using Ubuntu Lucid
on the same machine connected in an identical way.  The machine specific firewall could
be a factor but I am confident that the set up for Ubuntu Lucid and Debian Squeeze is
the same.  I will check, but I don't think this is an issue.

Investigating this issue stems from trying to write applications using networking.  The
application runs fine on Ubuntu Lucid, but fails on Debian Testing with "network
unreachable" arising from the DialHTTP calls.  My current hypothesis is that if the
above problem with the Go build is resolved, the problem with my application will get
solved.  If not I can then put forward a test case.  There seems no point in putting
forward a test case just now because of the test fails in the Go build.
